com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler

Class SchedulerFlags

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.SchedulerFlags

  • public class SchedulerFlags
extends java.lang.Object
    This class encapsulates global Scheduler settings retrieved from the environment. Presented as a non-static object to simplify scheduler tests, and to make it painfully obvious when global settings are being used in awkward places.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SchedulerFlags.FlagException
      Exception which is thrown when failing to retrieve or parse a given flag value.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static SchedulerFlags fromEnv()
      Returns a new SchedulerFlags instance which is based off the process environment.
      static SchedulerFlags fromMap(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> map)
      Returns a new SchedulerFlags instance which is based off the provided custom environment map.
      java.time.Duration getApiServerInitTimeout()
      Returns the configured time to wait for the API server to come up during scheduler initialization.
      int getApiServerPort()
      Returns the configured API port, or throws SchedulerFlags.FlagException if the environment lacked the required information.

      Returns whether it appears that side channel auth should be used when creating the SchedulerDriver.

      • isSideChannelActive

        public boolean isSideChannelActive()
        Returns whether it appears that side channel auth should be used when creating the SchedulerDriver. Side channel auth may take the form of Bouncer-based framework authentication or potentially other methods in the future (e.g. Kerberos).
